sen.j: 藤原 明子（ふじわら の あきらけいこ/めいし、天長6年（829年） - 昌泰3年5月23日 (旧暦)（900年6月22日））は、藤原良房と源潔姫の娘で文徳天皇の女御。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko (A.D.829 ~ June 22nd, 900) was a daughter between FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa and his wife, MINAMOTO no Kiyohime, and Nyogo (a court lady-next in the rank to the Chugu or Second Consort of the Emperor) of the Emperor Montoku.

FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko (A.D.829 ~ June 22nd, 900) was the daughter between FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa and his wife, MINAMOTO no Kiyohime, and Nyogo (a court lady-next in the rank to the Chugu or Second Consort of the Emperor) of the Emperor Montoku.

FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko (829-June 27, 900) was the daughter between FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa and his wife, MINAMOTO no Kiyohime, and nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court (a consort of an emperor)) of the Emperor Montoku.

sen.e: She was entitled to the "Empress" by her own son, the Emperor Seiwa, and also the "Grand Empress" by her grand son, the Emperor Yozei.

sen.e: It seems that she suffered from a kind of depression from around 865, which was implied in "Konjaku Monogatarishuu" (Tales of Times Now Past) as she was annoyed by mononoke (evil spirits).

sen.j: 彼女は、叔母である藤原順子、従妹の藤原高子とともに良房の（ひいては藤原家の）摂関政治の礎を築いたともいえるが、自ら表に出ようとはしなかった。
sen.e: Although it can be said that she established with her aunt FUJIWARA no Nobuko and a cousin FUJIWARA no Takaiko as well the cornerstone of the administration by regents and advisers of Yoshifusa, namely the Fujiwara family, she never wanted to go mainstream.
